item.title: How to replace coredns with kube-dns
item.description: CoreDNS is the default DNS addon in Kubernetes since 1.13. I recently needed to switch back to kube-dns for some testing, and it wasn’t obvious from the documentation how to do that. Here’s how I went about it for reference. These steps assume kubeadm 1.13. Steps First, initialise the master node, skipping the coredns addon phase: kubeadm init --pod-network-cidr=10.244.0.0/16 --skip-phases=addon/coredns Then prepare a kubeadm override config to specify kube-dns is to be used instead of the default:
